sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A track record of revenue growth at a 6% compound annual growth rate (CAGR) over the last five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net income in 2016 of $611 million, flat compared to 2015 net income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted net income in 2016 of $636 million, a 5% increase over 2015 adjusted net income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjusted EBITDA increased 6% over the prior year or 7% excluding the impact of foreign exchange and acquisitions, consistent with our long-term CAGR target of 6- 8%.

sentences.text: A track record of adjusted EBITDA growth at a 7% CAGR over the last five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 diluted earnings per share of $5.53, an 8% increase over 2015 diluted earnings per share, and diluted adjusted earnings per share in 2016 of $5.75, a 13% increase over 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A track record of double-digit diluted earnings per share growth and adjusted diluted earnings per share growth at a 17% and 18% CAGR, respectively, over the last five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, our net cash provided by operating activities was $973 million and we generated free cash flow of $782 million, exceeding $740 million in each of the last five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share repurchases totaling $625 million in 2016 and $5.0 billion since our inception following our 2006 spin-off from Cendant.

sentences.text: Share repurchases reduced diluted shares outstanding from 119 million shares in 2015 to 111 million shares in 2016, and from 200 million to 111 million shares since our inception.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Paid dividends of $223 million in 2016 and $1.1 billion since our inception.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Wyndham Rewards program  one of the blue threads that tie our brands together  is redefining loyalty for our customers by eliminating confusing rewards categories and instead offering a flat, free night redemption rate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Wyndham Rewards is the first major program of its kind to expand its redemption options beyond hotels to include both vacation ownership and vacation rental properties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Wyndham Rewards program enrollment increased by nearly 5 million new members in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Wyndham Rewards was named the number one hospitality loyalty program by U.S. News & World Report and the most generous program by IdeaWorks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Wyndham Hotel Group is the worlds largest hotel company based on number of hotels and is a leading hotel brand franchisor and hotel management services provider with a global portfolio consisting of over 8,000 properties and 697,600 rooms in 77 countries under 15 brands.

sentences.text: Our Executive Compensation Program and Governance Align with Shareholder Interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We engage in the following practices to ensure that our executive compensation program and governance align with our shareholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual incentive compensation program requires achievement of rigorous, profitability-based performance metrics designed to incentivize high-performance and achievement of annual financial goals and thus create value for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity awards granted to our named executive officers under our long-term incentive plan are designed to align their interests with our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity awards constitute approximately 75% of our executives target annual total compensation and vest over multi-year periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our incentive compensation program includes a performance-based equity incentive award, the vesting of which is contingent upon achievement of premium levels of adjusted earnings per share performance over a cumulative three-year period, incentivizing medium-term high performance and value growth for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We grant our named executive officers restricted stock units subject to multi-year vesting requirements designed to retain our executives and ensure that a significant portion of the executives' compensation is tied to long-term stock price performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is diverse and all of our Directors, other than our Chairman and CEO, are independent Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Board appointed a new Director, further increasing the diversity of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our Directors are accountable to shareholders through annual elections and we maintain a majority voting policy for uncontested Director elections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have implemented a shareholder outreach program to seek shareholder feedback on our governance and executive compensation practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, in response in part to feedback from our shareholders and the major proxy advisory services, we modified the peer group we use for compensation benchmarking in addition to adding a new Director, and in 2017, the Compensation Committee revised our CEOs equity-based compensation structure, increasing the percentage of his total target compensation that is performance-based to 67% to further align his interests with shareholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we achieve performance at maximum achievement levels, Mr. Holmes long-term equity incentive award payout will be 80% performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continue to review all of our governance and compensation practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO receives no tax gross-ups for personal aircraft use or other perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have policies prohibiting our Directors and senior executives from engaging in any hedging transactions in our equity securities and from pledging, or using as collateral, our securities to secure personal loans or other obligations, including holding shares in margin accounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our named executive officers do not have the right to receive severance solely upon the occurrence of a change-in-control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of our executive officers are entitled to any tax gross-up in connection with severance payments upon termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our core values of acting with integrity, respecting everyone everywhere, providing individual opportunity and accountability, improving our customers lives and supporting our communities, we are committed to strong ESG principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have publicly reported on ESG matters for the last six years demonstrating our commitment to and leadership in corporate social responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our teams have collaborated to integrate the strategic priorities of sustainability, diversity, human rights, ethics and community support directly
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: into our operations while at the same time consistently delivering strong performance across our businesses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2015, we announced that we met our goal to reduce carbon emissions of our operationally controlled assets by 20% by 2020, six years ahead of schedule.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have increased our target to reduce carbon emissions and water consumption by 40% by 2025.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continue to work with our businesses to reduce waste and will maintain our goal to ensure that 30% of our qualified supply chain spend is with suppliers who meet our Wyndham Green criteria by 2020.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2015, 27% of suppliers were considered to be in alignment with our sustainability initiatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we have reached our goal to plant one million trees which has helped us to improve our environmental footprint.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continue to receive positive feedback from our shareholders and other stakeholders for our commitment to strong ESG principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our ESG efforts are consistently honored and for the fourth consecutive year we were ranked by the Dow Jones Sustainability Index as the North American hospitality leader.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the last two years, the Carbon Disclosure Project has rated our climate change program and initiatives at the A level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Ethisphere Institute named us as one of the Worlds Most Ethical Companies and DiversityInc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: recognized us as one of the Top 50 Companies for Diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2017, we received a perfect score on the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Actions for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in more detail below, the compensation decisions and other actions applicable to our named executive officers were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, the Committee approved base salary merit increases for our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, we paid our named executive officers the base salaries listed in the Summary Compensation Table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, the Committee granted stocksettled stock appreciation rights (SSARs), timevested restricted stock units (RSUs) and performancevested restricted stock units (PVRSUs) to Mr. Holmes, our CEO, and RSUs and PVRSUs to our other named executive officers in the amounts listed in the Grants of PlanBased Awards Table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, the Committee approved the factors to be used to determine any potential 2016 annual incentive compensation for our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These factors are described below under Annual Incentive Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, the Committee approved 2016 executive perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named executive officer compensation for 2016 attributable to perquisites is described in the All Other Compensation Table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2016, 80% of the shares voted on our SayonPay Vote at our 2016 Annual Meeting of Shareholders affirmatively voted in support of the compensation of our named executive officers as described in our 2016 proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, the Committee approved and we paid our named executive officers 2016 annual incentive compensation in the amounts listed in the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO did not receive a 2016 annual incentive compensation payout for 2016 as described below under Annual Incentive Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes in our Compensation Program for 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee adopted certain changes to our named executive officer compensation program effective for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In August 2016, the Committee adopted changes to the peer group we use for compensation benchmarking  purposes,  as  described  below  under  Compensation  Review  and Benchmarking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, to better align us with our peers, external market trends and our shareholders interests,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: shareholders interests, the Committee approved a new compensation structure for our CEO which increases the portion of his total target compensation, consisting of base salary, target annual cash incentive award and target long-term incentive awards, that is performance-based and at-risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this new structure, Mr. Holmes base salary represents 11% of his total target compensation, his target annual cash incentive award represents 23% of his total target compensation, and his target long-term equity incentive award, comprised of 67% PVRSUs and 33% RSUs, represents 66% of his total target compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, for 2017, 67% of our CEOs total target compensation is performance-based and at-risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we achieve performance at maximum achievement levels, Mr. Holmes long-term equity incentive award payout will be 80% performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named Executive Officer Matters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, the employment agreement of Mr. Ballotti, CEO, Wyndham Hotel Group, was amended to extend the term of his employment agreement until March 2020.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2016, Mr. Hanning ceased serving as CEO, Wyndham Vacation Ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hannings severance was consistent with the terms of his employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On  or about April 28, 2017, Mr. Anderson will cease serving as our Executive Vice President and Chief Real Estate Development Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Andersons severance will be consistent with the terms of his employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of the employment agreements of our named executive officers as amended are described below under Agreements with Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total Compensation Strategy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We employ a Total Compensation Strategy designed to achieve the following objectives:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attract and retain superior senior management talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that attracting and retaining superior senior managers are integral to our ongoing success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our named executive officers possess extensive experience in our businesses and the hospitality industry segments in which we compete and demonstrate the exceptional leadership skills and commitment to excellence that we believe are critical to our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, our Total Compensation Strategy is designed in part to promote a longterm commitment from our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provide our executives with compensation that is consistent and competitive with compensation provided by comparable hospitality, service, franchise and brand portfolio companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We broadly target total compensation, consisting of base salary, cashbased target annual incentive compensation and equitybased target longterm incentive compensation, to be generally consistent with the market median but may approach the 75  percentile of our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also provide our named executive officers with perquisites which we believe are consistent with our peers and health, welfare and retirements benefits which are reviewed on a companywide basis and are deemed to be market competitive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: th
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Support a highperformance environment by linking compensation with performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our key goals are to increase our earnings, cash flow and shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with these goals, we believe a significant portion of our executive compensation should be contingent on actual results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, compensation levels are strongly influenced by corporate, business unit and individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Support a longterm focus for our executives that aligns their interests with the interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Longterm incentive compensation is intended to align the interests of our named
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: executive officers with those of our shareholders as well as support our goal of retaining our key personnel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Matters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Wyndham Worldwide Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is responsible for providing oversight on executive compensation policies and programs consistent with corporate objectives and shareholder interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee operates under a written charter adopted by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews the charter on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees membership is determined by the Board and is composed entirely of independent Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee Chair reports at our Board meetings on Committee actions and recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, Aon Hewitt was retained by the Committee as a third-party advisor to provide independent advice, research and evaluation related to executive compensation and was paid approximately $124,454 for its services during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this capacity, the Committee utilizes reports and analyses prepared by Aon Hewitt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Aon Hewitt was retained to provide the Committee with competitive market pay analyses including compensation measurement services, peer group proxy data studies and market trends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Wyndham Worldwide has historically engaged affiliates of Aon Hewitt for insurance brokerage and actuarial services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this capacity, management engaged Aon Risk Services, Inc., without Board involvement, to provide insurance brokerage and actuarial services to Wyndham Worldwide during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We paid approximately $1,215,000 to Aon Risk Services, Inc. for these services during 2016, which amount was offset by commissions paid to Aon Risk Services, Inc. by insurance carriers for placing Wyndham Worldwide policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Aon Hewitt has in place policies and procedures designed to prevent conflicts of interest and safeguard the independence of its executive compensation consulting advice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These policies and procedures include segregation of executive compensation services in a separate business unit with performance results of that unit measured solely based on the executive compensation services, clearly defined engagements with compensation committees separate from any other services provided, management of multiservice client relationships by separate account executives, no incentives provided for cross-selling of services and no more favorable terms offered to companies due to the retention of Aon Risk Services, Inc. for additional services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviewed the independence of Aon Hewitt in accordance with New York Stock Exchange requirements and considered this relationship.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on its review, the Committee concluded that no conflict of interest was raised by the services provided by Aon Risk Services, Inc. and determined that the executive compensation advice received from Aon Hewitt is objective and independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Managements Role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our management plays a significant role in our executive compensation process including evaluating executive performance and recommending base salary merit increases, performance factors for annual incentive compensation and long-term incentive compensation for the named executive officers other than our CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO works with the Committee to establish the agenda for Committee meetings and management prepares and distributes meeting information to Committee members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO also participates in Committee meetings at the Committees request to provide background information regarding our strategic objectives, his evaluation of the performance of the senior executives and compensation recommendations for senior executives other than himself.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO is not involved in setting his own compensation, which is the exclusive responsibility of the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, while the Committee reviewed managements recommendations, the Committee retained discretion over all elements and levels of the named executive officers compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Committee generally based its decisions on a combination of managements recommendations with respect to executive compensation other than for our CEO and the external market data provided by our management and compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Named executive officers, however, do not provide recommendations to the Committee as to their own compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee Consideration of SayonPay Vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We currently hold an advisory vote on the compensation of our named executive officers (Say-on-Pay Vote) on an annual basis in accordance with the preference
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: expressed by our shareholders at our 2011 annual meeting regarding the frequency of the Say-on-Pay Vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At this years annual meeting, we are again asking our shareholders to cast their advisory vote regarding the frequency of future Say-on-Pay Votes and recommend that our shareholders vote to continue our practice of holding our Say-on-Pay Vote annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain a shareholder outreach program to seek shareholder feedback on our governance and executive compensation practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 Annual Meeting, 80% of the shares voted on our Say-on-Pay Vote affirmatively voted in support of the compensation of our named executive officers as described in the 2016 proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviewed the outcome of the 2016 advisory vote and believes that the level of support affirms our current executive compensation structure and program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believed, however, based in part on feedback from shareholders and the major proxy advisory services, it was appropriate to implement the changes to our program described above under Changes in our Compensation Program for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the future the Committee will continue to review our executive compensation program taking into consideration the outcome of our Say-on-Pay Votes, shareholder and proxy advisory service feedback and other relevant factors in making compensation decisions for our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Evaluation and Compensation Risk Assessment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An important aspect of the Committees work relates to the annual determination of compensation for our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee meets each year to review the performance of the named executive officers and review, consider and approve any potential increases in base salaries, annual incentive compensation, grants of longterm incentive compensation and perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its annual review, the Committee reviews the potential for any material risks arising from or relating to our compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review, the Committee believes that our compensation programs do not encourage excessive risktaking by our executives or employees and are not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on Wyndham Worldwide.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reaching its conclusion, the Committee considered the following aspects of our compensation programs believed to encourage the management of our business in a prudent manner:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews and compares executive compensation against our peer group to confirm that compensation is within an acceptable range relative to the external market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our performancebased compensation is in large part keyed to our earnings, aligning interests of shareholders and management, and designed to improve our core operating results as opposed to using leverage or other high risk strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual incentive compensation opportunities and PVRSUs are capped at a specified maximum as a countermeasure to excessive risktaking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our commissionbased sales programs are monitored by management for compliance with law and internal policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have employment agreements with each of our named executive officers the terms of which form the basis of our named executive officers compensation elements and levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation elements provided under the agreements are reviewed annually by management, our compensation consultant and the Committee against the peer group described below under Compensation Review and Benchmarking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No employment agreements were amended in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, the employment agreement of Mr. Ballotti, CEO of Wyndham Hotel Group, was amended to extend the term of his employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of the employment agreements with our named executive officers, including this amendment, are described below under Agreements with Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Review and Benchmarking
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management and the Committee believe that information regarding compensation practices at other companies is useful in evaluating the compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management and the Committee recognize that our compensation practices must be competitive in the market to attract and retain superior senior managers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, this market information is a factor that management and the Committee consider in assessing the reasonableness of the compensation of our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 and 2017 Peer Group Composition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Committee utilized the peer group of companies listed below, as previously recommended by our compensation consultant and approved by the Committee, based on one or more of the following criteria: companies or divisions within companies in generally the same industry or business as Wyndham Worldwide; companies that were similar in size to Wyndham Worldwide in terms of revenues and market value; companies used by analysts to compare Wyndham Worldwides financial performance; organizations with a global presence; organizations with which we compete for executive talent; and organizations in similar markets or with a similar business model such as nonhospitality companies that have franchise and brand portfolio operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our peer group for 2016 executive compensation benchmarking consisted of the following companies:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: American Express Company Intercontinental Hotels Carnival Corporation & Plc Marriott International, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Choice Hotels International, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MGM Mirage Colgate Palmolive Company Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Darden Restaurants, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Starbucks Corporation Expedia Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Starwood Hotels & Resorts Worldwide, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ryman Hospitality Properties Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Walt Disney Company Host Hotels & Resorts, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Wynn Resorts, Limited Hyatt Hotels Corp.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Yum Brands, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In August 2016, the Committee reviewed our peer group composition used for executive compensation benchmarking purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of this review, the Committee determined to make changes to our peer group, effective for 2017, based upon the review and recommendation of Aon Hewitt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following companies were added to the peer group: Hilton Worldwide Holdings Inc., a direct competitor and similar in size to the company; Las Vegas Sands Corp., a global business in a related industry; and Priceline, a competitor in e- commerce.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the following companies were removed from the peer group for reasons related to size, change in structure, acquisition of the company or limited availability of data: American Express Company, The Walt Disney Company, Ryman Hospitality Properties Inc., InterContinental Hotels and Starwood Hotels & Resorts Worldwide, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our peer group for 2017 executive compensation benchmarking consists of the following companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carnival Corporation & Plc Las Vegas Sands Corp.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Choice Hotels International, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Marriott International, Inc.

sentences.text: Colgate Palmolive Company MGM Mirage Darden Restaurants, Inc.

sentences.text: 2016 Peer Review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, our compensation consultant conducted a competitive review of the compensation elements and levels of our named executive officers using the 2016 peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this review, our compensation consultant prepared and management provided the Committee with total compensation summaries and tally sheets for the named executive officers together with related peer group data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The objectives of the compensation review were to compare for consistency the compensation of our executives to that of similarlysituated executives and ensure that our compensation practices and elements are consistent with our Total Compensation Strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation consultants review of peer group compensation included the following compensation elements using the most recently filed proxy statements for each peer company: base salary, annual incentive compensation, timebased longterm incentive compensation, total cash compensation and total compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation levels were obtained for the peer group median, average, 25  and 75  percentiles for each compensation element at target level performance (excluding for this purpose premium levels of performance under our annual and longterm incentive compensation programs) to provide an understanding of our compensation practices against competitive pay practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For certain executives, such as our Chief Real Estate Development Officer, due to limited comparability of peer group data, this data, along with supplemental general industry survey data provided by our compensation consultant, is used only as a broad competitive reference point.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: th th
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using this competitive review and consistent with our Total Compensation Strategy, we broadly target total compensation (consisting of base salary, target annual incentive compensation and target longterm incentive compensation) to be generally consistent with the market median but may approach the 75  percentile of the peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Committee does not view this benchmark as a rigid standard because the Committee does not believe that categorical guidelines or formulae are appropriate for determining the mix or levels of compensation for our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee views benchmarking simply as one factor in making compensation decisions for our named executive officers as it does not account for subjective factors such as challenges we face as a company, individual past and expected future performance, leadership ability, recruiting and retention needs, succession planning, experience or scope of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, our named executive officers target compensation opportunities as well as actual total compensation may be above or below targeted levels based on these factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees review of peer group data in 2016 confirmed that actual total compensation paid to our named executive officers was generally consistent with or below the 75  percentile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In one instance, where our NEOs actual total compensation fell below our intended benchmark, the Committee approved a market adjustment to base salary as discussed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: th th
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On an annual basis our compensation consultant also reviews the general framework and elements of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review, our compensation consultant advised management and the Committee that the elements of compensation that we provide our named executive officers are consistent with the compensation elements provided by our peer group companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this review, our compensation consultant prepared tally sheets for each named executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to reviewing market data, the Committee reviews these tally sheets which identify the value of each compensation element, including base salary, annual incentive compensation, longterm incentive compensation, perquisites and the value of severance and changeincontrol payments under various termination and changeincontrol scenarios against internal targets as well as performance of competitors, recruiting and retention pressures, internal pay equity and succession and development planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reviewing the tally sheets helps the Committee to balance the various compensation elements so that no single element is too heavily weighted and there is an appropriate mix between fixed and variable compensation and shortterm and longterm compensation to ensure alignment with our Total Compensation Strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As each compensation element has different objectives as discussed below, Committee review and determinations with respect to one element generally do not influence decisions regarding the other elements to the extent total compensation is consistent with our Total Compensation Strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given the significant scope and responsibilities of our CEO, which are greater than those of our other named executive officers, the Committee believes any differences between the individual compensation elements and the total compensation of our CEO and the other named executive officers are appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our Total Compensation Strategy, we provide base salaries designed to attract and retain our named executive officers and provide them with a base level of income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016 base salary merit increases, management provided the Committee with a market assessment of annual salary increases utilizing external market data from World at Work, Aon Hewitt, Towers Watson and Mercer annual salary increase surveys.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We based the 2016 merit increases on this market analysis and a review of the 2015
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: individual performance of the named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To review the individual performance of our named executive officers, senior management (or in the case of our CEO, the Committee) reviews the executives individual contributions and personal leadership together with their performance on corporate or business unit strategic objectives including business development, business drivers and cost reduction initiatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, the Committee approved 2016 base salary merit increases for each of our named executive officers that were effective February 20, 2016 based on their performance evaluations and maintaining market competitiveness.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, we paid our named executive officers the base salaries listed in the Summary Compensation Table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, although the company had solid financial results in 2016, the Committee, upon review of our named executive officers against their peers, determined not to provide merit increases to their 2017 base salaries with the exception of Ms. Mandel who received a 10% market adjustment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our Total Compensation Strategy, we provide cashbased annual incentive compensation designed to create incentives for the named executive officers to drive our shortterm financial and operating performance and thus create value for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, management recommended and the Committee approved a combination of factors to determine potential 2016 annual incentive compensation for our named executive officers including actual total company (corporate) and/or business unit Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT), as adjusted, a standard measure of our profitability, as measured against target EBIT established at the beginning of the plan year, and a target award opportunity generally expressed as a percentage of each executives base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An executives annual incentive compensation may be higher or lower than target annual incentive compensation depending on corporate and/or business unit performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum annual incentive award opportunity for our named executive officers under the annual incentive compensation program is 150% of the target award opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The EBIT targets set for the corporation and its business units are recommended by management subject to approval by the Committee and are based on operating budgets that reflect our strategic plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EBIT may be adjusted to reflect certain items which may be recurring or non-recurring and which in our view do not necessarily reflect ongoing performance such as restructuring costs and impairments, the categories of which are specified at the outset of the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our Total Compensation Strategy, we believe that the EBIT targets set appropriate goals for our executives to achieve short-term earnings growth and create shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We further believe that using our annual incentive compensation program to provide incentives to our named executive officers to exceed the EBIT targets and accomplish our strategic objectives is an important tool to implement our Total Compensation Strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the completion of each year, the Committee reviews the corporate and business unit operating results achieved against the preestablished EBIT targets approved by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, as a threshold matter, to ensure that the performance of the individual executives is at the high level expected, senior management reviews with the Committee (or in the case of our CEO, the Committee itself reviews) each executives individual contributions and personal leadership together with their performance on corporate or business unit strategic objectives, business drivers, business development and other initiatives as applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If based on this review, performance at the corporate, business unit or individual level did not meet expectations, the Committee may use its discretion to adjust downward or not provide the executives annual incentive compensation award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our 2016 annual incentive program, the preestablished performance tiers ranged from 97% up to 105.6% of the EBIT target for the corporation and each business unit, with corresponding payout levels ranging, respectively, from 25% of the target award opportunity up to a maximum of 150% of the target award opportunity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payout level is interpolated where performance is achieved between the specified performance tiers subject to the 150% maximum payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance achievement below 97% of the EBIT target for the corporation or a business unit results in no payout with respect to any portion of the award based on such corporate or specific business units performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, EBIT targets and results were as follows: the corporate EBIT target was $1.13 billion and actual adjusted corporate EBIT was $1.12 billion or 99.5% of the target; the Wyndham Hotel Group EBIT target was $329.4 million and actual Wyndham Hotel Group adjusted EBIT was $328.3 million or 99.7% of the target; the Wyndham Destination Network EBIT target was $290.9 million and actual Wyndham Destination Network adjusted EBIT was $300.5 million or 103.3% of target; and the Wyndham Vacation Ownership EBIT target was $677.1 million and actual Wyndham Vacation Ownership adjusted EBIT was $633.9 million or 93.6% of the target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual incentive compensation paid to Mr. Holmes was weighted 100% on the corporate results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviewed the corporate results together with Mr. Holmes individual performance and determined that he would have been eligible to receive a 2016 annual incentive compensation award at 65% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, notwithstanding the companys solid 2016 operating performance in a continuing challenging industry environment, because our largest business unit, Wyndham Vacation Ownership, did not meet its minimum EBIT target required for payout, Mr. Holmes suggested to the Committee and the Committee independently determined for 2016 that Mr. Holmes annual incentive compensation award would be zero.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees decision not to award the CEO an annual incentive compensation award for 2016 was intended to emphasize to all stakeholders our commitment to  accountability  and  aligning  company  interests  with  the  interests  of  our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance at the Wyndham Vacation Ownership business unit and its impact on overall corporate results was also taken into account in managements recommendations and the Committees determinations with respect to the annual incentive payouts for our other named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual incentive compensation paid to Mr. Conforti and Mr. Anderson was weighted 100% on the corporate results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management reviewed the corporate results together with Mr. Confortis and Mr. Andersons individual performance and recommended to the Committee that each receive 2016 annual incentive compensation at 65% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual incentive compensation paid to Mr. Ballotti was weighted 25% on the corporate results and 75% on Wyndham Hotel Group results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management reviewed the Wyndham Hotel Group and corporate results together with Mr. Ballottis individual performance and recommended to the Committee that he receive 2016 annual incentive compensation at 85.3% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual incentive compensation paid to Ms. Mandel was weighted 25% on the corporate results and 75% on Wyndham Destination Network results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management reviewed the Wyndham Destination Network and corporate results together with Ms. Mandels individual performance and recommended to the Committee that she receive 2016 annual incentive compensation at 109.8% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NonEquity Incentive Plan column of the Summary Compensation Table below lists the annual incentive compensation we paid our named executive officers for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LongTerm Incentive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our Total Compensation Strategy, we provide our named executive officers with longterm incentive compensation to create incentives to achieve share price appreciation for the benefit of shareholders and encourage retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, 2016 longterm incentive compensation for our named executive officers focused on aligning their interests with those of shareholders, achieving competitiveness with the external market, rewarding key talent contributions and retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Longterm incentive compensation is granted under our 2006 Equity and Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation consultant and the Committee periodically review our plan design to confirm its consistency with our peers with respect to items such as longterm incentive mix prevalence and vesting provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, due to the large portion of our named executive officers total target compensation that is attributable to longterm incentive compensation, our compensation consultant and the Committee reviewed longterm incentive amounts exclusive of our longterm incentive plan (LTIP) modifier awards against peer data and confirmed general consistency with our Total Compensation Strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management annually recommends to the Committee an aggregate budget available for longterm incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the aggregate budget was allocated based on the relative number of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: eligible executives in corporate services and the business units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Longterm incentive compensation is then recommended by management (other than for our CEO, which is determined by the Committee) and granted by the Committee to the named executive officers based on individual performance review, tenure, scope of responsibility and future potential.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Elements of individual performance considered by the Committee in such review include corporate or business unit results of operations, achievement of strategic objectives and leadership characteristics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on these factors, the Committee determined our CEOs 2016 annual longterm incentive award to be in the form of 25% SSARs and 75% RSUs plus an LTIP modifier in the form of PVRSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our other named executive officers, annual longterm incentive awards were granted in the form of RSUs plus an LTIP modifier in the form of PVRSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed below, PVRSUs are viewed as a modifier of the annual longterm incentive awards because premium performance in excess of target must be achieved in order for any portion of the PVRSUs to be earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A SSAR represents the right to receive a number of shares of common stock equal in value to the excess of the fair market value of a share of our common stock on the date of exercise over the exercise price of the SSAR and provides the executive incentive to drive longterm share price appreciation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A RSU represents the right to receive a share of our common stock on a set vesting date subject to continued employment and provides the executive incentive to drive share price appreciation while encouraging retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A PVRSU represents the right to receive a share of our common stock on a set vesting date subject to achievement of preestablished earnings per share performance goals and continued employment and provides the executive incentive to drive earnings growth and share price appreciation while encouraging retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance goals for our PVRSU awards are set by the Committee at levels that exceed our threeyear projected target earnings per share established at the time of grant of the PVRSU award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target earnings per share represents a level of earnings per share consistent with our projected operating budget.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because PVRSU awards vest only if actual earnings per share, as adjusted, exceed target earnings per share, the probable outcome with respect to these awards at the time of grant is that earnings per share in excess of target earnings per share will not be achieved and no PVRSUs will be earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee believes that the PVRSU performance goals are consistent with the Committees intention of making the vesting of these awards contingent upon achieving exceptional growth in earnings per share that strongly benefits shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vesting of PVRSUs is contingent upon achievement of the levels of performance specified below and where performance is achieved between these specified performance tiers the number of vested PVRSUs is interpolated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The levels of performance set forth below were used to set PVRSU awards for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No shares vest under the terms of these awards unless our cumulative earnings per share performance exceeds 102% of target earnings per share at the end of the threeyear performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Achievement as % of Cumulative EPS Target Level of Vesting as % of Total PVRSUs 100% 0% of PVRSUs 102% 0% of PVRSUs 104% 33% of PVRSUs 106% 67% of PVRSUs 108% 100% of PVRSUs (maximum)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total cost of PVRSUs is fully funded by achievement of the earnings per share performance goals, which represent premium levels of earnings growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The earnings per share results may be adjusted to reflect certain items which may be recurring or non-recurring and which in our view do not necessarily reflect ongoing performance, such as restructuring costs and impairments, the categories for which are
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: specified at the outset of the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to achievement of performance tiers, vesting occurs on the third anniversary of the grant date or later upon certification of results by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with the objectives described above, in February 2016, the Committee granted SSARs, RSUs and PVRSUs to Mr. Holmes and RSUs and PVRSUs to each of our other named executive officers in the amounts listed in the Grants of PlanBased Awards Table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2014, PVRSU awards were granted to our named executive officers covering a threeyear performance period including years 2014, 2015 and 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, these PVRSU awards vested at the maximum level due to earnings per share growth that exceeded 108% of the threeyear cumulative earnings per share target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 Outstanding Equity Awards at Fiscal Year End Table provides additional information regarding the results of our 2014 PVRSU awards and performance through 2016 year end with respect to outstanding PVRSU awards granted in 2015 and 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, to better align us with our peers, external market trends and our shareholders interests, the Committee approved a new structure for our CEOs 2017 long- term incentive awards which increases the portion that is performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approximately 67% of our CEOs 2017 target long-term incentive award was granted in the form of PVRSUs and the remaining 33% was granted in the form of RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, for 2017, 67% of our CEOs total target compensation is performance-based and at-risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we achieve premium levels of performance at maximum, Mr. Holmes long-term equity incentive award payout will be comprised of 20% RSUs and 80% PVRSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See above under Changes in our Compensation Program for 2017 for additional information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide our named executive officers with perquisites that management and the Committee believe are reasonable, competitive and consistent with our Total Compensation Strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management and the Committee believe that our perquisites help us to retain highly talented managers and allow them to operate more effectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, management provided the Committee with and the Committee reviewed a market assessment of competitive perquisite practices utilizing widely available market data publications from Aon Hewitt and other compensation consultants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this information, the Committee found our 2016 executive perquisites to be consistent with market practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, the Committee approved perquisites for the named executive officers including a leased automobile and financial planning services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For certain perquisites, the named executive officers other than Mr. Holmes receive a tax grossup payment, which means they receive additional compensation to reimburse them for the amount of taxes owed on the compensation imputed for the perquisite.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2015, Mr. Holmes requested that he no longer receive tax grossup payments on perquisites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As permitted under his employment agreement, for 2016 we provided Mr. Holmes with personal use of company aircraft for which we imputed income without a tax grossup.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The All Other Compensation Table below lists compensation attributable to perquisites provided to the named executive officers for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Officer Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our nonqualified officer deferred compensation plan permits named executive officers to defer base salary and annual incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We match executive contributions to the plan up to 6% of base salary and annual incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive makes an irrevocable deferral election prior to the beginning of the calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executive may elect a single lumpsum payment of his or her account or may elect payments in annual installments up to ten years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The participants entire account balance is 100% vested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The contributions to our officer deferred compensation plan applicable to our named executive officers are listed below in the Nonqualified Deferred Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 401(k) Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide all employees, including our named executive officers, with a 401(k) plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 401(k) plan permits named executive officers to defer base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide named executive officers and other participants a company match of base salary contributed up to 6% of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company match is 100% vested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Savings Restoration Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We make available to our named executive officers a savings restoration plan, which allows executives to defer compensation in excess of the amounts permitted by the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (Code), but there are no matching contributions for these deferrals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of our named executive officers have a balance under our Savings Restoration Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance Arrangements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The employment agreements of our named executive officers provide for payments as a percentage of base salary and annual incentive compensation, as well as accelerated vesting of specified longterm equity grants, and in the case of PVRSUs, vesting based on performance during a specified period, if the executives employment is terminated without cause or for a constructive discharge.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These payments and terms are discussed more specifically below under Agreements with Named Executive Officers and Potential Payments on Termination or ChangeinControl.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The severance terms for the named executive officers were established in connection with their employment agreements consistent with peer group market practices and data provided by our compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe these arrangements are necessary to attract and retain our executives and ensure the continuity of management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary focus of the severance terms is generally on the termination of employment and thus the value of these terms arises only in the context of imminent termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The severance terms do not enhance an executives current income and therefore are independent of the peer group data review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ChangeinControl Arrangements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a changeincontrol of Wyndham Worldwide, the named executive officers receive cash severance payments only if their employment is terminated without cause or for constructive discharge following the changeincontrol.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our named executive officers are not entitled to any excise tax grossup in connection with their changeincontrol arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Longterm equity compensation grants made to all eligible employees, including the named executive officers, fully vest on a changeincontrol.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payments and terms of our named executive officers changeincontrol arrangements are discussed below under Agreements with Named Executive Officers and Potential Payments on Termination or ChangeinControl.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The changeincontrol terms for the named executive officers established in connection with their employment agreements are generally consistent with peer group market practices and data provided by our compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since a potential changeincontrol transaction generally results in increased shareholder value, the Committee believes that it is important to provide incentives to motivate the named executive officers to pursue and complete a potential transaction should it arise and ensure retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Like the severance arrangements, the value of the changeincontrol arrangements arises only in the context of an imminent changeincontrol.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms do not enhance the named executive officers current income and therefore are independent of the peer group data review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Officer Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Executive Officer Stock Ownership Guidelines are intended to align further the financial interests of executive officers with the interests of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guidelines require our named executive officers to own our common stock with a market value at least equal to the following multiples: CEO: 4 times base salary, Business Unit CEO and our CFO: 2 times base salary, and all other executive officers: 1 times base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock ownership meeting the guidelines includes common stock and RSUs but excludes PVRSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, all of the named executive officers exceeded these stock ownership requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policy Against Hedging and Pledging of Company Stock
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our insider trading policy contains restrictions on transactions in our securities by our Directors, executive officers and other employees who have regular access to material nonpublic information in the normal course of their duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this policy, these parties are prohibited from directly or indirectly purchasing financial instruments or engaging in any derivative transactions that are designed to hedge, offset or eliminate the risk of any decrease in the market value of Wyndham Worldwide securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These persons are also prohibited under this policy from pledging Wyndham Worldwide securities as collateral for personal loans, including holding Wyndham Worldwide securities in margin accounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviewed and discussed with management the Compensation Discussion and Analysis contained in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review, the Compensation Committee recommended to the Board of Directors that the Compensation Discussion and Analysis be included in this proxy statement for filing with the SEC.

sentences.text: Agreements with Named Executive Officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following describes our employment, termination and related arrangements with our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional information regarding the termination arrangements of our named executive officers can be found under Potential Payments on Termination or ChangeinControl.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Holmes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In July 2006, we entered into an employment agreement with Mr. Holmes with a term expiring in July 2009, which term automatically extended to July 2010 pursuant to the terms of the agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In December 2008 and December 2012, we executed amendments to the agreement intended to either exempt payments and benefits under the agreement from or comply with Section 409A of the Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2009, we executed an amendment to Mr. Holmes agreement which extended the term of his employment from July 2010 to July 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amendment provides that the failure to extend Mr. Holmes period of employment or to enter into a new employment agreement with him upon the expiration of his employment term will constitute a constructive discharge under his agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the amendment provides that in the event of a constructive discharge or a without cause termination, Mr. Holmes is entitled to a lump sum payment equal to 299% of the sum of his thencurrent base salary plus an amount equal to the highest annual incentive compensation paid to him for any of the three years immediately preceding the year in which his termination occurs, provided that in no event will the annual incentive compensation portion exceed 200% of his thencurrent base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amendment also eliminates Mr. Holmes right to elect to terminate employment and receive severance solely upon the occurrence of a changeincontrol and eliminates his right to receive a grossup in the event an excise tax under Section 4999 of the Code is triggered under his agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As amended, his employment agreement provides that in the event Section 4999 of the Code is triggered, his compensation will be reduced to $1 below the threshold that triggers excise taxes under the Code, but only to the extent that the net aftertax amount received after the reduction is higher than what he would receive if he paid the applicable excise and related taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2013, we executed an amendment that extended the term of Mr. Holmes employment for a period of two years from July 2013 to July 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amendment also included a provision clarifying the vesting of performancebased equity awards upon specified termination events.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2015, we executed an amendment that extended the term of Mr. Holmes employment until July 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Holmes agreement provides for a minimum base salary of $1 million, annual incentive compensation with a target amount equal to 200% of his base salary subject to meeting performance goals, grants of longterm incentive compensation as determined by the Compensation Committee and employee benefits and perquisites generally available to our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agreement provides Mr. Holmes and his dependents with medical, dental and life insurance benefits through the end of the year during which he reaches age 75, subject to Mr. Holmes payment of required employee contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Holmes agreement provides that if his employment is terminated without cause or due to a constructive discharge, death or disability, all of his thenoutstanding equity awards will fully vest (subject to performance conditions in the case of performancebased equity awards) and, as applicable, remain exercisable for varying periods as described in the agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The agreement provides for customary restrictive covenants including noncompetition and nonsolicitation covenants effective during the period of employment and for two years after termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Anderson's employment letter provides that if his employment is terminated other than for cause and other than due to disability which prevents him from performing services for a period of 6 months, he will be entitled to receive a lump sum payment equal to 200% of his then-current base salary plus an amount equal to the highest annual incentive compensation paid to him for any of the three years immediately preceding the year in which his employment is terminated (with the annual incentive compensation portion in no event to exceed 100% of his then-current base salary).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The employment letter further provides that upon Mr. Anderson's termination without cause, he will be entitled to vesting of his outstanding time-based equity awards that would otherwise vest within one year following termination and up to a two-year period to exercise any such awards that are stock options or stock appreciation rights; and vesting of his outstanding performance-based long-term incentive awards to be paid on a prorated basis following the performance period, subject to achievement of performance goals, based on the portion of the performance period during which Mr. Anderson was employed plus twelve months (or if less, the entire performance period).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Anderson will cease serving as our Executive Vice President and Chief Real Estate Development Officer on or about April 28, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proration will be determined based on the portion of the performance period during which Mr. Anderson was employed plus twelve months (or if less, the entire performance period), and any earned PVRSUs will be paid to Mr. Anderson at the same time that the awards are paid to eligible employees.

sentences.text: A termination of an executive officer is for cause if it is for any of the following reasons: the executives willful failure to substantially perform his or her duties as our employee (other than any such failure resulting from incapacity due to physical or mental illness); any act of fraud, misappropriation, dishonesty, embezzlement or similar conduct against us or the executives conviction of a felony or any crime involving moral turpitude (which conviction, due to the passage of time or otherwise, is not subject to further appeal); the executives gross negligence in the performance of his or her duties; or the executive purposefully or negligently makes (or has been found to have made) a false certification to us pertaining to our financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the individual employment agreements, an executive suffers a constructive discharge if any of the following occur: any material breach or failure by us to fulfill our obligations under the executives employment agreement; any material reduction in base salary; or any material diminution to the executives authority, duties or responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Mr. Holmes, constructive discharge also includes our decision not to renew his employment agreement; a relocation of over thirty miles; if he no longer serves as our CEO or reports to the Board; or is not nominated for election to our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A without cause termination occurs if the executives employment is terminated other than due to death, disability or termination for cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, a without cause termination will also be deemed to have occurred for Mr. Holmes if an acquiring company does not agree to assume his employment agreement following a qualifying changeincontrol or ownership.

sentences.text: Under our 2006 Equity and Incentive Plan, a changeincontrol generally means any person or persons (other than us, any fiduciary holding securities under a company employee benefit plan or any of our subsidiaries) becomes the beneficial owner of 30 percent or more of our outstanding voting shares, a merger of Wyndham Worldwide or any of our subsidiaries is consummated with another company, our stockholders approve a plan of liquidation of the company or all or substantially all of our assets are sold (and following each of the foregoing events, a majority of our prechangeincontrol Board does not constitute a majority of the surviving or purchasing entitys board); or individuals who presently make up our Board or who become members of our Board with the approval of at least twothirds of our existing Board (other than a new Director who assumes office in connection with an actual or threatened election contest) cease to be at least a majority of the Board.
